author: Special Correspondent
text:
Special abishekam, poojas, and rituals marked the transit of celestial planets Rahu and Ketu in various temples in Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, and Nagapattinam districts on Friday with thousands of devotees flocking the shrines to participate in the events. On Friday, on the occasion of the transit of Raghu from Kanya Rasi to Simha Rasi while Ketu moved from Meena Rasi to Kumbha Rasi.

Thousands of devotees watched the rituals performed by the priests to the idols of Raghu Bhagwan and His divine consorts Nagakanni and Nagavalli at the special shrine located in the Sri Naganatha Swamy temple at Thirunageswaram near Kumbakonam where He blesses devotees as Mangalam Raghu.

Laksharchanai and special homams were performed at the shrine for the benefit of devotees from January 4 and culminated with the ritual of abishekam with milk, honey and sandal at the time of transit. HR and CE Assistant Commissioner Jeevanandam officials made elaborate arrangements for the smooth conduct of the event. Ketu Bhagwan transit was observed in a grand manner at the special shrine dedicated to the plant at the Sri Naganatha Swamy temple complex at Keezhaperumpallam near Poompuhar in Nagapattinam district where too hundreds of devotees participated in the rituals. At Thiruppamburam devotees thronged the Sri Vandaarkuzhali samedha Sri Seshapureeswarar temple that is famed for propitiating both Raghu and Ketu planets on the occasion.

That apart, the celestial transit of the planets were marked by special abishekam, poojas, and deeparadanai in almost all Shiva temples that had Navagraha idols in the delta districts.
title: Special pujas performed for Rahu, Ketu
